description.narrative: Kopernik: Emergency Relief for Central Sulawesi

More than 82,000 people in Central Sulawesi have been displaced from their homes and are struggling to get access to basic supplies after a major earthquake and tsunami devastated parts of the province on 28 September 2018. Kopernik will deliver need that have been identified including clean water, lights, food, kitchen equipment shelter kits, hygiene materials and hygiene education, sleeping needs, and studying tools for children.

More than 82,000 people in Central Sulawesi have been displaced from their homes and are struggling to get access to basic supplies after a major earthquake and tsunami devastated parts of the province on 28 September. Walls of water of up to 6-meters high hit the beaches of Palu, the capital city of Central Sulawesi, and Donggala over the weekend shortly after a 7.4-magnitude earthquake. As of the evening of 8 October, the National Disaster Mitigation Agency (BNPB) has reported 2,010 dead and more than 10,500 injured mostly after being found trapped under collapsed buildings. As search and rescue efforts continue, authorities expect the number of casualties to rise. The twin disasters damaged tens of thousands of buildings and infrastructure in the region, hindering coordination efforts and logistics for relief agencies and the government. As vital supplies struggle to reach to affected areas, residents have reported that supply of food and drinking water are running out. On 2 October, the Guardian reported that some had faced four days without food and drinking water. Given the large numbers of people still outside of their homes there are significant risks and need that have been identified including clean water, lights, food, kitchen equipment shelter kits, hygiene materials and hygiene education, sleeping needs, and studying tools for children.
Kopernik will work in Palu and its surrounding area, Donggala, and Pantai Barat Donggala: 1. Loli Pesua village, Banawa sub district, Donggala 2. Tompe village, Sirenja sub district - Pantai Barat, Donggala 3. Boladangko village, Kulawi subdistrict, Sigi Biromaru
Kopernik propose to conduct the following activities: 1. Needs Assessment
2. Distribution of 1000 family packages, including: a. Kitchen kits (plates, cutlery, cups, pots, food items). b. Hygiene kits: soap bars, shampoo, detergent, toothpaste, bucket, sanitary pads c. Sleeping items: mat, sarong, bed sheet, blanket d. Study tools for families with children: books, pens, pencils, coloring pencils e. solar light f. water filter
3. Capacity building and disaster mitigation
4. Hygiene education

title.narrative: Number of people reached with hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities

comment.narrative: 500 families increased their knowledge on hygiene in camps

Hygiene promotion for children were conducted in Jono Oge village, Sigi district and Tompe village, Donggala district, with total 137 children participated (76 boys and 61 girls) in Jono Oge and 173 children (82 boys and 91 girls) participated in Tompe village. Packages of Information, Education and Communication (IEC) materials were developed and produced to support these activities.
